subject: Self Care
title: The Always-On Problem
description: A 60-second lesson on The Always-On Problem.

hook.text: The notification arrived at 11 PM. He checked it. Then replied. Then couldn't sleep. The workday never ended.

buildup.text: Always-on culture means the boundary between work and rest dissolves. Your brain never gets the shutdown signal.

discovery.text: Anticipatory stress â€” just knowing an email might come â€” raises cortisol even when no email actually arrives.

twist.text: Being constantly available doesn't make you more productive. It fragments attention and prevents deep recovery.

climax.text: Set hard digital boundaries: no work notifications after a set time. The world will survive until morning.

punchline.text: Always-on means never-off. Set a hard stop daily.

quiz.question: What does anticipatory stress from constant connectivity cause?
options: Raised cortisol even when no notifications actually arrive
